div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 248px; height: 1px; padding-top: 130px; margin-left: 241px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
- Create .env containing OPENAI API KEY
- Create .gitignore to ensure .env file is not pushed to github

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 248px; height: 1px; padding-top: 270px; margin-left: 241px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
chatbot.ipynb
- Load dotenv, openai and os
- use os and dotenv to load the .env file
- Set OPENAI API KEY from .env content
- Use OPENAI chat completion endpoint to test the chatbot
- Store user messages and bot replies in a list to create a converation
- Get corresponing cost for each API call
-Â Combine these steps to a function

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 248px; height: 1px; padding-top: 445px; margin-left: 241px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
simple_app.py
- Create a simple gradio chatbot interface that takes a user mesaage and replies with either
"How are you?"
,
"I love you"
,
"I'm very hungry"

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 248px; height: 1px; padding-top: 608px; margin-left: 241px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
app.py
- Update the chatbot to use streaming - where bot replies would be rendered as a stream of text
-
user
function handles inputs from the user in a textbox
-
bot
function handles replies from bot u=in the chatbot interface

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 248px; height: 1px; padding-top: 608px; margin-left: 562px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
backend.py
-
add_text
function to mimic
user
function, set a system role (this sets the behaviour of the chatbot) and keeps a history of previous conversations
-
generate_response
function to mimic
bot
function, and make the chatcompletion api call
-
calc_cost
to keep track of corresponding total cost for each session

div.div:
- Use
pipreqs
to generate a
requirements.txt
file which contains the required packages used in the project

div.div:
- Use hf token to deploy gradio app to an hf space using
gradio deploy
- Most default values are valid except yes for creating GiHub actions

div.div:
-
gradio deploy
would create a GitHub action workflow that updates the deployed on every push to the
master
branch
- Add
hf_token
secret as a repo secret to ensure the workflow can login to the hf space

switch.text: - gradio deployÂ would create a GitHub act...

div.div:
chat completion roles
-
user
user prompt message
-
assistant
reply from bot
-
system
setting bot behaviour
